children.contentDescription:
Ast BiS Sets for Anabaseios, updated for 6.5
None of the sets include any additional Piety. Ast has incredible MP economy and can function perfectly fine at base Piety.
Ideally AST will use either the yuricry, March 7th or Rampardos Theorem set.
The last 3 sets are an option if you play other healers regularly, they come at a slight damage loss to AST but makes the others jobs more comfortable, especially SCH.

Note that at any given speed, crit-focused and DH-focused sets perform extremely similarly on average. Crit-focused sets have better maximum potential, but again, the difference is very small.

2.46 is currently broadly recommended for comfort, but both 2.45 and 2.47 are viable and your play experience may depend on ping, framerate, and other similar factors.

The sets listed here are prog gearsets, intended for use going into savage at release. If you are looking at this more than a week or two after savage release, they may not be applicable to you.

These sets fall into three categories, each with a slightly different purpose.
- Full Crafted sets consist only of fully pentamelded crafted gear, and are the best achievable without spending time farming tomes. These are good if money is not a constraint and you do not have time to farm for tomes (e.g., if racing for a fast clear).
- 1 Tome piece sets use the first week of tomes to get slightly better results than the full crafted sets. We recommend using these sets if you are willing to invest in pentamelded crafted gear, but also have the time to get tomes. They will be the best-performing sets at their speeds for week 1.
- Budget sets use a mixture of gear to minimize the cost of pentamelded crafted gear. Since budgets vary, these should be taken as basic examples --- you can of course put more melds on your crafted gear if budget allows.

Speeds:
2.50 will generally result in better damage, but you may find other speeds more comfortable. This is up to personal preference.

This sheet contains BiS sets for DRK with 7.05, Chaotic, and Edenmorn gear.

Speed should be chosen primarily according to comfort, although fight-specific timings may also affect which speed is best for damage in a way that is not reflected by sims.

2.45 sets are included primarily for comparison purposes, for those who want to play other tanks that prefer 2.45.
A selection of best in slot gear for DRK for patch 7.2.
A set of recommended sets for Savage progression, containing 2.50 and 2.46 recommendations and options depending on how many tomes you will have access to.
A selection of 2.50 and 2.45 BiS options for DRK in DSR for 7.15 onwards with DPS comparisons between the sets.

This sheet contains BiS sets for FRU for DRK as of patch 7.2.

Both 2.50 and 2.46 are comfortable skill speeds for FRU. Go with whichever you find comfiest.
A set of TEA BiS options for DRK.

A set of UWU BiS options for DRK.

Both 2.50 and 2.40 sets are provided, as some find that 2.40 has better alignment for the fight.
A set of TEA BiS options for PLD.

A set of UCoB BiS options for PLD.

Most sets are 2.50, but we include one set at 2.48 for completeness, which takes advantage of free speed on the Shadowbringers relic.

A set of UWU BiS options for PLD.

Most sets are 2.50, but we include one set at 2.48 for completeness, which takes advantage of free speed on the Shadowbringers relic.
Best-in-slot scholar gear sets for savage, updated 6.55

sets are splitbetween p7 strats. 
3-3-2 require more gcd healing for two of the three ahk morns requiring actual piety for the fight. 
6-1-1 requires less gcd healing for two of the three ahk morns and if you are familiar with your role it should feel fine to go a lower amount of piety.

min piety is fine in top, piety doesn't help much in the fight because safe times to die don't give you much time to make use of it before downtime.

Pick a set you enjoy if you want to add piety then you can bring the 630 piety ring.
Sage's Best-in-slot gear sets for Anabaseios
Best-in-slot sets for the Anabaseios raid tier in 6.4
